page.title: 12THE SEA BATHING HOSPITAL.
page.content: THE FIRST BUILDING WAS OPENED IN 1796 TO TREAT THE Â£SCROFULOUS POOR' OF LONDON. THE CURE INCLUDED SEA WATER BATHING AND DRINKING SEA WATER.THE HOSPITAL CLOSED IN WINTER.PATIENTS ARRIVED BY SAILING BOAT OR STAGECOACH. THE PRESENT DAY MAIN BLOCK OF WARDS,ALL NAMED AFTER QUEEN VICTORIA'S DAUGHTERS, WERE BUILT IN 1867. IN 1985 THERE ARE 7 WARDS,AN OPERATING THEATRE,PLASTER ROOM,PHYSIOTHERAPY DEPT.,HYDROTHERAPY POOL,SPLINT DEPT.,LEATHER AND METAL WORKSHOPS,X-RAY FACILITIES,AND A SCHOOL FOR YOUNG PATIENTS. IT IS PRINCIPALLY AN ORTHOPAEDIC HOSPITAL AND THE MAIN OPERATION IS TO REPLACE DISEASED HIP JOINTS WITH A PLASTIC SUBSTITUTE. TREATMENT IS ALSO GIVEN FOR FRACTURES, SPINA BIFIDA,SCOLIOSIS,AND CONDITIONS CONNECTED WITH RHEUMATISM AND ARTHRITIS.
